Pharmacists play an important role as active members of the healthcare team.
39 Internationally pharmacists are integrated into pandemic planning and response.
40 Not only do they have an effective role in clinical settings,
41 but in community settings they can play an important role in the community by making pharmaceutical products available and by enhancing health awareness among the public.
14
,
42 Along those lines, participants in the present study believed that they could play an effective role during the COVID-19 pandemic. This was through infection control, by counseling individuals regarding hygiene practices needed to reduce infection spread. More than 80% of participants knew how to act in seeking immediate medical attention if they suspected someone may have the coronavirus infection. This study supports the notion that pharmacists are willing to and do play an important role in infection control and public safety,
43 and in assuring public health and wellbeing.
